com.forgerock.opendj.cli

Class ConnectionFactoryProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.forgerock.opendj.cli.ConnectionFactoryProvider

  • public final class ConnectionFactoryProvider
extends Object
    A connection factory designed for use with command line tools.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectionFactoryProvider(ArgumentParser argumentParser, ConsoleApplication app)
      Default constructor to create a connection factory designed for use with command line tools, adding basic LDAP connection arguments to the specified parser (e.g: hostname, bindname...etc).
      ConnectionFactoryProvider(ArgumentParser argumentParser, ConsoleApplication app, String defaultBindDN, int defaultPort, boolean alwaysSSL)
      Constructor to create a connection factory designed for use with command line tools, adding basic LDAP connection arguments to the specified parser (e.g: hostname, bindname...etc).

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionFactoryProvider

        public ConnectionFactoryProvider(ArgumentParser argumentParser,
                                 ConsoleApplication app)
                          throws ArgumentException
        Default constructor to create a connection factory designed for use with command line tools, adding basic LDAP connection arguments to the specified parser (e.g: hostname, bindname...etc).
        Parameters:
        argumentParser - The argument parser.
        app - The console application linked to this connection factory.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - If an error occurs during parsing the arguments.

      • ConnectionFactoryProvider

        public ConnectionFactoryProvider(ArgumentParser argumentParser,
                                 ConsoleApplication app,
                                 String defaultBindDN,
                                 int defaultPort,
                                 boolean alwaysSSL)
                          throws ArgumentException
        Constructor to create a connection factory designed for use with command line tools, adding basic LDAP connection arguments to the specified parser (e.g: hostname, bindname...etc).
        Parameters:
        argumentParser - The argument parser.
        app - The console application linked to this connection factory.
        defaultBindDN - The bind DN default's value.
        defaultPort - The LDAP port default's value.
        alwaysSSL - true if this connection should be used with SSL.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - If an error occurs during parsing the elements.

        Returns the connect time out.

      • getHostname

        public String getHostname()
                   throws ArgumentException
        Returns the host name if the argument is present otherwise, if the application is interactive, prompt the user for it.
        Returns:
        The host name value.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - If the host name cannot be retrieved.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Get the port which has to be used for the command.
        Returns:
        The port specified by the command line argument, or the default value, if not specified.

      • useSSL

        Indicate if the SSL mode is required.
        Returns:
        True if SSL mode is required

      • useStartTLS

        public boolean useStartTLS()
        Indicate if the startTLS mode is required.
        Returns:
        True if startTLS mode is required

      • getDefaultProtocols

        public static List<String> getDefaultProtocols()
                                        throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Return a list of the available TLS protocols to use.

        All protocols starting with "SSL" are removed. In particular the SSLv2Hello pseudo protocol is removed which will prevent connections to a server that doesn't have this configured.

        To override the defaults, set the org.opends.ldaps.protocols system property to a comma-separated list of desired protocols.

        Returns:
        A list of valid protocol strings.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If an SSL context could not be created.

      • getDefaultProtocols

        public static List<String> getDefaultProtocols(SSLContext sslContext)
                                        throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • getAuthenticatedConnectionFactory

        public ConnectionFactory getAuthenticatedConnectionFactory()
                                                    throws ArgumentException
        Constructs a connection factory for pre-authenticated connections. Checks if any conflicting arguments are present, build the connection with selected arguments and returns the connection factory. If the application is interactive, it will prompt the user for missing parameters.
        Returns:
        The connection factory.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - If an error occurs during the parsing of the arguments (conflicting arguments or if an error occurs during building SSL context).

      • getUnauthenticatedConnectionFactory

        public ConnectionFactory getUnauthenticatedConnectionFactory()
                                                      throws ArgumentException
        Constructs a connection factory for unauthenticated connections. Checks if any conflicting arguments are present, build the connection with selected arguments and returns the connection factory. If the application is interactive, it will prompt the user for missing parameters.
        Returns:
        The connection factory.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - If an error occurs during the parsing of the arguments (conflicting arguments or if an error occurs during building SSL context).

      • getBindName

        public String getBindName()
                   throws ArgumentException
        Returns the bind name if the argument is present otherwise, in interactive mode, it will prompt the user.
        Returns:
        The bind name used for this connection.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - If the bind name cannot be retrieved.

      • getBindRequest

        public BindRequest getBindRequest()
                           throws ArgumentException
        Returns the bind request for this connection.
        Returns:
        The bind request for this connection.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - If the arguments of this connection are wrong.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • getKeyManager

        public X509KeyManager getKeyManager(String keyStoreFile)
                             throws KeyStoreException,
                                    IOException,
                                    NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                    CertificateException,
                                    UnrecoverableKeyException
        Retrieves a KeyManager object that may be used for interactions requiring access to a key manager.
        Parameters:
        keyStoreFile - The path to the file containing the key store data.
        Returns:
        A set of KeyManager objects that may be used for interactions requiring access to a key manager.
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException - If a problem occurs while interacting with the key store.
        IOException - If there is an I/O or format problem with the keystore data.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If a problem occurs while loading with the key store.
        CertificateException - If a problem occurs while loading with the key store.
        UnrecoverableKeyException

      • getPassword

        public char[] getPassword()
                   throws ArgumentException
        Get the password which has to be used for the command. In interactive mode, if the password arguments are missing, the user will be prompted.
        Returns:
        The password stored into the specified file on by the command line argument, or empty it if not specified.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - If a problem occurs while interacting with the password.

      • getTrustManager

        public TrustManager getTrustManager()
                             throws IOException,
                                    GeneralSecurityException
        Retrieves a TrustManager object that may be used for interactions requiring access to a trust manager.
        Returns:
        A set of TrustManager objects that may be used for interactions requiring access to a trust manager.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the trust store file could not be found or could not be read.
        GeneralSecurityException - If a problem occurs while interacting with the trust store.

      • setIsAnAdminConnection

        public void setIsAnAdminConnection()
        Specifies if this connection should be an administrator connection. If sets as one, the messages prompted to the user will be different as a normal connection. E.g if set : 
         >>>> Specify OpenDJ LDAP connection parameters

 Directory server administration port number [4444]:
        vs normal mode 
         >>>> Specify OpenDJ LDAP connection parameters

 Directory server port number [1389]:
